author: yperbasis
content: I would actually relax the 38005 checks and demand it only in the case when payloadAttributes != nil. "if resolvable by EL" in "if the `forkchoiceState.headBlockHash` refers to a pre-Cancun block (if resolvable by EL) when forkchoice update issued without `payloadAttributes`"  is a bit vague. Besides, there's no semantic difference between fcuV2 and V3 w/o a payload. So I'd stipulate the 38005 check for both fcuV2 and fcuV3 only when payloadAttributes != nil.

author: m.kalinin
content: Makes sense to me to leave it relaxed. Ready to merge the PR as is. Let me know if everyone else is good with it
